For a sketch of current research projects, please have a look at our research page. CV I studied Psychology and Physics at the University of Konstanz and at the University of California, San Diego. Diplom in Psychology (1995) at the University of Konstanz. After my Diplom I first moved to the University of Freiburg and then to the Max-Planck-Institute for Biological Cybernetics in Tübingen. Dissertation (2000) at the University of Bochum and at the Max-Planck-Institute for Biological Cybernetics in Tübingen. From 2002 until 2010 I was at the University of Giessen in the department for General and Experimental Psychology, where I finished my Habilitation (2005). In April 2010 I was appointed professor for General Psychology at the University of Hamburg. In Feb 2016 I started as professor for Experimental Cognitive Science at the University of TÃ¼bingen.
